result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith L Mays

records.addlTxt:
NEW ORDER ON CONDITIONS FROM 10/19/2022:  Court ordered CAM monitoring be REMOVED.

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness 1 listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:30 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Keith L Mays in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Keith L Mays.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defense Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Barnes presents arguments; she is asking to have the condition of CAM monitoring removed.  State presents statements and will not take a position with respect to Atty. Barnes' request.  Atty. Barnes presents additional statements.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant Defense Motion to Modify Bail; Court will remove the condition that the defendant be on CAM monitoring and all other conditions remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled jury status on 12/12/2022 at 9:30 a.m. and the jury trial set to begin on 12/13/2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion for Modification of Bond, filed by Attorney Barnes.

Case called for jury status hearing.

State objects to the witness. 
This case is #2 on the trial calendar. 
Court adjourns the trial. Court will not issue another trial scheduling order as documents have been filed.

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Priya Barnes
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Keith L Mays
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 1505 Big Bend Rd,#102, Waukesha, WI 53189

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness 1 listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within two (2) business day of being released.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

03:48 PM Defendant Keith L Mays in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Patrick Sicula.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
